alert.note: Alert for Lemhi (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 3:04PM MDT until June 14 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Salmon River At Salmon affecting Lemhi County. .Recent rains at high elevations have accelerated runoff for streams feeding into Salmon River. For the Salmon River...including At Salmon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Salmon River At Salmon. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Some farmland and low lying areas near Salmon may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 7.6 feet this evening. It will then slowly fall below flood stage by Tuesday afternoon. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 300 PM MDT.
